footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Jean | Update Date: 10/21/2023 | Editor: ._.samantha._.

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Favonius Sword__ 
Generates more energy in exchange for damage.

__Primordial Jade Cutter__
 Greater damage but requires more energy recharge.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon(s):
fields.value: Sacrificial Sword, Mistsplitter Reforged, Skyward Blade, Festering Desire, Amenoma Kageuchim (R5), Iron Sting, Wolf Fang

fields.name: Main Stats Priority
fields.value: <sands> ATK% or Energy Recharge |<goblet>  Anemo DMG Bonus |<circlet>  CRIT Rate or CRIT DMG

fields.name: Substats Priority
fields.value: Energy Recharge| CRIT Rate or CRIT DMG| ATK%

fields.name: Talent Priority
fields.value:
**1)** Elemental Skill: Gale Blade
**2)** Elemental Burst: Dandelion Breeze
**3)** Normal Attack: Favonius Bladework

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value: This build is focused on Jean in geo and anemo teams where she can't swirl reliably.

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Freedom-Sworn__ Increased personal and team damage but requires higher energy recharge.

__Favonius Sword__ Generates energy for the whole team in exchange for personal damage.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon(s):
fields.value: Sacrificial Sword, Iron sting, Skyward Blade, Amenoma Kageuchi

fields.name: Main Stats Priority
fields.value: <sands> Elemental Mastery or Energy Recharge |<goblet>  Elemental Mastery |<circlet>  Elemental Mastery

**2)** Elemental Skill: Gale Blade
**3)** Normal Attack: Favonius Bladework

footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Jean | Update Date: 10/21/2023 | Editor: ._.samantha._.

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Primordial Jade Cutter__
The high CRIT Rate substat helps a lot with building physical Jean, the low base attack is mitigated by the passive.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon(s):
fields.value: Aquila Favonia, The Black Sword, Prototype Rancour

fields.name: Main Stats Priority
fields.value: <sands> ATK% |<goblet>  Physical DMG Bonus |<circlet> CRIT DMG

fields.name: Notes:
fields.value: Marechaussee Hunter does require you to get hit enough, but with her passive healing from normal attacks, she can somewhat reliably keep the stacks.
